articles.title: Delta pilot says "that was close" after go-around at Boston's Logan Airport; FAA investigating - CBS News
articles.description: The FAA is investigating an apparent close call at Logan Airport Thursday involving a Delta Air Lines flight that was landing and a Cape Air plane that was taking off.

articles.title: Paramount’s No Good Very Bad Week - The Hollywood Reporter
articles.description: Top talent jumping ship, massive layoffs, Warner Bros. rejecting an acquisition bid, a messy shakeup at CBS News. David Ellison's golden age for Paramount has sailed into some choppy waters.

articles.title: US retailers are running out of pennies - BBC
articles.description: Find a penny, pick it up, then what? Now the US has stopped making pennies,  a shortage has emerged and created confusion.

articles.title: Supermajors Chevron And Exxon Mobil Reported Another Quarterly Profit Decline But One Is Closing The Gap - Investor's Business Daily
articles.description: Chevron and Exxon Mobil reported third-quarter earnings and revenue before the stock market open Friday.

articles.title: Canada Backs 25 Critical Minerals Projects in G-7 Initiative - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: Rio Tinto Group and Nouveau Monde Graphite Inc. are among more than a dozen companies set to benefit from a Group of Seven initiative to strengthen access to critical minerals.

articles.title: S&P 500 Gains and Losses Today: Amazon Stock Surges as Cloud Business Boosts Earnings; DexCom Drops - Investopedia
articles.description: The world's largest online retailer got a lift from its booming cloud computing business on Friday, Oct. 31, 2025, while a soft sales outlook weighed on a medical device firm's stock.

articles.title: Wall Street Confronts Fed Doubts as Bill Gross Sells Treasuries - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: Wall Street closed out October on a high. AI optimism, solid earnings, and easier financial conditions lifted stocks to their sixth consecutive month of gains while credit just notched its third straight advance.

articles.title: Netflix Just Announced a 10-for-1 Stock Split. Should You Buy NFLX Stock Here? - Barchart.com
articles.description: Netflix stock extends gains as the company announces a 10-for-1 stock split and media reports suggest it wants to buy WBD’s studio and streaming assets. But is there further upside left in NFLX shares?

articles.title: Big Tech To Wall Street: AI Spending Boom Will Intensify - Investor's Business Daily
articles.description: Microsoft, Google, Amazon, Meta and Apple vow to continue to ride, the AI megatrend.

articles.title: Mark Zuckerberg drops in billionaire ranks after losing $29B in single day as Meta stock tanks - New York Post
articles.description: Investors recoiled from Meta’s plan to issue $30 billion in new debt to fund artificial intelligence spending.

articles.title: Three billionaires dropped by a fried-chicken joint—and Jensen Huang bought everyone dinner - Fortune
articles.description: Nvidia’s Jensen Huang sparked a Korean-fried-chicken stock surge after a viral dinner in Seoul.

articles.title: Rural residents ‘in an uproar’ over OpenAI’s massive data center project south of Ann Arbor - MLive.com
articles.description: An AI data center in southern Washtenaw County will move forward despite initial rejection by local officials and ongoing resident concerns.
